data.title: !B - Fixes broken references between level XML and atlas
data.body:
Don't worry about the absolute paths in the GLEED XML file, the tool does that. That's why you need to specify the atlas file or the textures folder as a custom property. The problem, as you can see, is that I messed up in the naming.

Sorry about that, it's working nicely now.

data.title: Gdx gleed
data.body:
Adds a GLEED2D level loading and rendering system. The test has a white textures problem though.

Thanks!

data.title: option to draw the body's velocity
data.body:
An option to draw the velocities of bodies. It uses #drawSegment to draw a colored (red) vector from the body's center.
I've disabled the option by default since it adds quite a bit of visual noise in the box2d tests.

Edit: The velocity wasn't sufficient for my case so I'd like to be able to extend the debug renderer with some application specific code. For this case I've moved the Body drawing code to a separate, protected, function.

data.title: Make LwjglTestStarter accept a test name on the command line
data.body:
This saves us a click or press of the Enter key when running the same
test over and over again.

data.title: Issue 1099: Pool#free -> Pool#freeAll
data.body:
In [pull request 90](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/90) we changed Pools#free(Array) to Pools#freeAll(Array). I previously missed this similar function in Pool and now propose to make the same change there.

There are two differences between Pool#free and Pool#freeAll at the moment.

The doc for Pool#free states " If the pool already contains max free objects, the specified object is ignored". This however, is not true.
Pool#free will always call #reset if the given object is Poolable but Pool#freeAll will not. I suspect the former is the expected behaviour and Pool#freeAll should do the same.

Secondly, if the array contains null values they are currently added to freeObjects. I suspect it's preferable to skip any null objects in the array instead.

data.title: Fixed scene2d Group to avoid calling begin/end when not needed
data.body:
Group was calling batch.begin() and batch.end() when applying a transform or reseting a transform. That wasn't needed since batch.setTransform() already calls flush() and renders everything that was waiting to be rendered. 

Also, we get an improvement since a lot of bind/unbind of the current shader of the batch and changes of the opengl state is avoided. 

Already tested, but please give it a second review if you can. 

Thanks.

data.title: use #setColor(float) te reduce code duplication
Ideas for HTTP API for Net
data.body:
Just a sketch of the API for HTTP stuff in Net, hope you could take a look at it, if we all agree in it, I can start implementing it for the different backends.

I believe a possible change is to add the URL as a parameter of createHttPrequest too, since it is a required parameter and leaving it as a setUrl() doesn't seem the best idea (just thought about it when writing this).

data.title: low-level IAP Interfaces
data.body:
After spending a few days researching the various IAP services (GooglePlay, iOS, Amazon, Intel AppUp, Apple Mac Store), here is my proposal for addition of a platform-independent IAP system to libgdx. Not sure where it would be added if accepted - maybe Gdx.net? 

Please have a look at  the PurchaseManager javadoc: I added some examples how to (1) setup the system, (2) make purchases and (3) restore purchase. That's basically all that there is to it. It is very simplistic but it will allow to support IAP on all platforms.

To make it platform-independent, there is no support for downloadable content/listing of items/icons/prices etc. It might be a good idea to create some services/wrappers around the basic interfaces I provided in the long run (e.g. someone could setup a server) that would take care of all that. 

Please provide feedback - I am happy to revise.

data.title: New rotation methods for Vector3 and Camera
data.body: Added Vector3.rotate (to rotate by given angle around given axis) and Camera.rotateAround (to rotate around given axis attached to given point, useful if one wants to rotate a camera while still looking at the same point).

My first pull request and first time using git, go easy :)

data.title: Issue 1103: OgreXml loader fails to create a SkeletonSubMesh

Fixed boneAssigments per mesh.
Fixed reading multiple animation tracks.
Fixed meshName not being read.

data.title: Shaderprogram, replace string lookup by int lookup
data.body:
I've been testing this change for over a month now and haven't found any problems with it. It shouldn't break backward compatibility with existing code (except for a deprecated warning perhaps). It doubled my fps when using large shaders (alot of uniforms and attributes).

The original implementation used a lot of string comparisons to find the location of the uniform/attribute. This change adds the ability to use an int for that. It maintains a global array of all uniform/attribute names and uses the index within that array to identify the attribute/uniform.

For now it uses a helper class (Parameter) to map the global id to the location and type within that shader. It can be futher optimized by using one, two or three int[] array instead. In my tests I found that shader locations could be just as well the index of that array. I'm currently experimenting with that, but i'm afraid that it might break in some rare situations. So the helper class is just to be safe.

I added "ByGUID" to the methods to identify the difference between location and guid (both int). I'm not sure about that naming, but haven't come up with something better. Any suggestions are welcome.

data.title: Rename Array#free(Array) to Array#freeAll() (Fix for issue 1099)
data.body: Alright, if the method is deemed useful, can we rename it?

data.title: Proposed fix for issue 1099.
data.body:
Remove the method Pools#free(Array) since the method is currently unused (accept by accident).
If you do want to keep this method around it could be renamed to Pools#freeAll(Array) or similar.

Not really a must have, since we can always get a drawable from the skin
and call setBackground, but that way it's harmonized with the other

data.title: Issue 1091: Render on resize, half fix
data.body:
...jglGraphics.java

Half fix ofIssue 1091:    Render on resize.
Will now render when the window becomes dirty, usually when the window gets moved or when the window gets resized bigger.

I am not too sure how to get the condition for resizing without calling Display.update constantly, as that method updates Display.wasResized()

data.title: Gdx tests
data.body: The first three commits make GdxTests a bit more convenient to use. The fourth commit enhances the MultitouchTest (as it was intended, probably).

data.title: spelling error: Simultanious -> Simultaneous
data.body: A simple spelling error, but it is visible in the public API.

data.title: moved BulletTest to GdxTests, removed old test
data.body:
With the addition of the test made by xoppa, the bullet library gained a dependency on lwjgl. All the more reason to move the test to GdxTests.
I credited xoppa as the author of the test and removed the BulletTestOld.

Any further tests should perhaps be done in a similar manner to the Box2DTestCollection.

data.title: spelling error: Simultanious -> Simultaneous
data.body: A simple spelling error, but it is visible in the public API.

data.title: iOS: display in pixels + net sockets bugfixed/tested
data.body:
As discussed, I converted everything to pixels. OpenGL, window size, inputs etc. is now pixels! @Mario: this is how you wanted it from the beginning. Again, I have no preference pixels vs points. The only reason I did points at first was that's what appears to be the default on iOS. Now, that we forced iOS to use pixels, let's go with pixels :-D

EDIT: I also got the sockets (both client + server) to work on iOS. Doing a timeout-based accept() method turned out to be a major pain to implement (over async callbacks). In any case, sockets are fully working on the iOS backend too (tested with Tropical Stormfront). And yes, sockets are full working on LWJGL + Android as well :)

data.title: added missing SetMaxLength wrapper for b2RopeJoint
data.body: After some tinkering, I managed to build this by running the "gdx" project from Eclipse choosing GdxBuild for the main class, then running "ant -DbuildNatives=true". It appears to work, even!
